Platform.Title: Indian Institute of Science, Salmonella Typhimurium 15K array version 1
Platform.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. LT2

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Link-Suffix: [gene name] AND Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium[organism]

Sample.Title: Wild type Salmonella vs Salmonella harbouring pTrc99A(-LacI)

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. LT2
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: T7 promoter based-linear amplification to generate labeled complementary RNA

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. LT2
Channel.Characteristics: wild type Salmonella transformed with pTrc99A(-LacI)
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: T7 promoter based-linear amplification to generate labeled complementary RNA

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 1. Carefully pipette entire 40 ul sample mixture onto the middle of the array surface. Do not allow direct contact of the array surface with pipette tip, as this may scratch the array surface. Avoid creation of air bubbles in the hybridization buffer. 2. Gently overlay the cover slip onto the solution on the array by positioning the cover slip at one end of the array and lowering it down until it is in contact with the hybridization solution. Be sure the solution covers the entire array footprint. Small bubbles will not to lose hybridization. 3. Pipet 500 ul of 2X SSC onto a flat, folded dust free tissue. This is sufficient to maintain the humidity inside the hybridization chamber. 4. Very carefully, place the microarray slide over the damp tissue and seal the cap tightly. Be very careful that the cover slip does not slip off. Be sure that the array does not touch the tissue as this may remove hybridization solution from the array surface through capillary action. 5. Place the tube in a 650 C incubator. Ensure the microarray, now enclosed in the tube, is level and stable in the incubator. Allow the hybridization to proceed overnight (18 hours) at this temperature.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Laser detection of Cyanine 3 and Cyanine 5 fluorescence is performed using a confocal scanning instrument containing two tuned lasers, which excite Cyanine dyes at the appropriate wavelengths.
Sample.Description: Grid and spot alignment is performed by using Scanarray microarray analysis software form PerkinElmer.
Sample.Data-Processing: Scan data (Raw data) is analyzed using GeneSpring GX v7.3. Per spot per chip lowess normalization was done. To account for dye swap, the signal channel and control channel measurements for sample(s) 2 were reversed. A Lowess curve was fit to the log-intensity versus log-ratio plot. 20.0% of the data was used to calculate the Lowess fit at each point. This curve was used to adjust the control value for each measurement. If the control channel was lower than 10 then 10 was used instead. Biological analysis was done using Genotypic's Biointerpreter software.

Series.Title: Effect of LacI (lac repressor) on transcription in Salmonella
Series.Summary: Salmonella is an important enteric pathogen that causes a spectrum of diseases varying from mild gastroenteritis to life threatening typhoid fever. Salmonella does not have lac operon. However, E. Coli, Salmonella’s close relative, has lac operon. Being an enteric pathogen like E. coli, Salmonella will also benefit from lac operon. Then, why Salmonella has lost lac operon?. To address this question, lacI, an important component of lac operon was expressed in Salmonella via pTrc99A plasmid. As a control, pTrc99A without lacI was also expressed in Salmonella. The effect of LacI on the transcription profile of Salmonella was analyzed using microarray technique.
Series.Overall-Design: Overall design The total RNA was isolated from Salmonella using ‘RNeasy Mini Kit’ (QIAGEN). Organism used: Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium LT2 * Slides: Agilent’s arrays (8x15k) AMADID: NO: 17809 * Starting material: Salmonella RNA in nuclease-free water * RNA Samples used: Wild type (WT), WT + pTrc99A+LacI (PTRC), WT + pTrc99A-LacI(Delta lac) * Labeling kit: MessageAmp™ II-Bacteria RNA Amplification Kit from Ambion Cat # AM1790 * Labeling Method: T7 promoter based-linear amplification to generate labeled complementary RNA * Total RNA and cRNA Purification Kit: Qiagen’s RNeasy minikit Cat#74104 * Hybridization Kit: Agilent’s In situ Hybridzation kit 5184-3568 * RNA quality was checked using Bioanalyzer. The array slides were scanned immediately by PerkinElmer Scan array Gx Microarray scanner. The Scan array software (PerkinElmer) was used for grid wise normalization of array images. Two arrays were used with mutant and rescue experiments and dye swap experiments were included in the final analysis. The data was analysed by GeneSpring GX and Biointerpreter software from Genotypic Technology, Bangalore. The differential expression was considered if the Log 2 mean of at least -1 for the down regulated genes and +1 for the upregulated genes. We considered only the genes that were reproducible from both replicates.
